contentrichtext.text: [[Image:NieuweMerwedeTrace.png|thumb|300px|right|The projected trajectory of the Nieuwe Merwede canal, circa 1868 (dotted lines).]]The '''Nieuwe Merwede''' ("New Merwede") is a [[canal]] that was constructed in 1870 to form a branch in the [[Rhine]]-[[Meuse (river)|Meuse]] [[River delta|delta]]. It was dug along the general [[trajectory|trajectories]] of a number of minor [[Biesbosch]] [[creek (stream)|creek]]s to reduce the risk of flooding by diverting the water away from the [[Beneden Merwede]], and to facilitate navigation and regulate river [[traffic]] in the increasingly silted-up delta. It is one of several rivers called [[Merwede]]. The river [[Boven Merwede river|Boven Merwede]] ("Upper Merwede"), itself the continuation of the [[Nederrijn|Rhine]]-[[Waal (river)|Waal]] and [[Meuse river|Meuse]] (now [[Afgedamde Maas]]) rivers after their confluence at [[Gorinchem]], branches near the [[town]] of [[Hardinxveld-Giessendam]] into River [[Beneden Merwede river|Beneden Merwede]] ("Lower Merwede") to the northwest and the Nieuwe Merwede to the southwest. The Nieuwe Merwede joins River [[Bergse Maas]] near [[Drimmelen|Lage Zwaluwe]] to form the [[Hollands Diep]] [[estuary]], and separates the [[Dordrecht|Island of Dordrecht]] from the [[Biesbosch]] [[National Park]]. There are no [[bridge]]s or [[tunnel]]s crossing the Nieuwe Merwede, but there is a [[Automobile|car]] [[ferry]] from the [[Dordrecht|Island of Dordrecht]] on the west at "Kop van 't Land" to Brabantse Oever, [[Werkendam]] (Biesbosch). ==External links== *[http://www.voetveren.nl/F000134.htm The ferry across the Nieuwe Merwede] <gallery> Image:Biesbosch_20050928_40011.JPG|Nieuwe Merwede in the middle </gallery> [[Category:Canals in the Netherlands]] [[Category:Rhine–Meuse–Scheldt delta]] {{coord|51|47|15|N|4|45|50|E|display=title|region:NL}} {{Rhine–Meuse–Scheldt delta}}
